title: Hypocrisy is that Britishers ignore their own atrocities – Karannagoda on UK sanctions
byline: In response to the UK sanction on the Sri Lankan officials including three former military leaders, former Navy Commander, Admiral of the Fleet Wasantha Karannagoda has accused the UK of hypocrisy, stating that while British colonial atrocities in Sri Lanka and India remain unaddressed, the UK is targeting Sri Lanka with human rights sanctions.

title: How can the UK sanction military leaders for ending a war against terrorism?: Mahinda Rajapaksa
byline: Former President and leader of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Mahinda Rajapaksa has strongly criticized the United Kingdom for imposing sanctions on Sri Lanka’s former military leaders, questioning how the UK could penalize those who ended a war against terrorism.

title: Current monetary policy stance is appropriate: CB
byline: The Central Bank, as widely expected, left the key policy rate unchanged at its second monetary policy review held earlier this week, as it reiterated that the current monetary policy stance is appropriate in achieving its desired inflation target of 5 percent, while supporting the ongoing recovery in the economy.

title: 6.8 million TINs issued for easier access to government services
byline: A total of 6.8 million Taxpayer Identification Numbers (TINs) have been issued so far for the citizens in the country, making it easier for them to obtain government services, Inland Revenue Commissioners Association President and Senior Commissioner M.A. Priyanka sai

title: India surpasses Sri Lanka to become second largest tea exporter
byline: According to data released by the Tea Board of India, India has exported 254 million kg of tea in 2024, thus becoming the second-highest exporter in the world. While Kenya retained the first spot in global tea exports, India surpassed Sri Lanka to take the second spot. Kenya exported over 500 Mkg of tea in 2024.

title: Trump announces 25% tariffs on car imports to US
byline: US President Donald Trump has announced new import taxes of 25% on cars and car parts coming into the US in a move that threatens to widen the global trade war.

title: Rise in foreigners driving three-wheelers sparks accidents in SL
byline: Sri Lanka Police said that there has been a noticeable increase in the trend of foreigners driving three-wheelers in Sri Lanka, accompanied by a rise in related fatal and other accidents in recent times.
